Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery amphora; exterior, cream slip: from top, tongues at base of neck with added red on every third; one wide black band with band woth added red band lined in white; black-figure decoration consisting of part of grazing goat (back and antler remaining) to left; dashes and cross as filling ornament; possible inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
A single vertical scratch on the neck may be part of an intentional inscription.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.007)
